headline: Northern Trust commits to independence after WSJ report on potential merger with BNY
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Northern Trust is fully committed to remaining independent, the bank said on Monday, after the Wall Street Journal reported that Bank of New York Mellon had approached the asset and wealth manager to express interest in a merger.  "I can tell you that Northern Trust is fully committed to remaining independent and continuing to deliver long-term value to our stakeholders, as we have for the past 135 years," its spokesperson said in an email.  Northern Trust's shares were up 6.5% on the Wall Street Journal report.
